content:
Congratulations on your recent 5K personal best! With your triathlon goal in June, we'll focus on building your endurance and speed in all three disciplines: swimming, biking, and running. Given your preferences, here's a sample workout calendar for the next four weeks, with a mix of cardio and strength training sessions:

**Weeks 1-2:**

| Day | Time | Workout | Duration |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mon | 6:30 am | Swim (endurance) | 45 min |
| Tue | 6:30 am | Bike (easy spin) | 45 min |
| Wed | 6:30 am | Strength Training (lower body) | 45 min |
| Thu | 6:30 am | Run (intervals) | 45 min |
| Fri | 6:30 am | Rest or Active Recovery (e.g., yoga, walk) | 30 min |
| Sat | 7:00 am | Bike (brisk ride) | 60 min |
| Sun | 7:00 am | Run (long, steady state) | 60 min |

**Weeks 3-4:**

| Day | Time | Workout | Duration |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mon | 6:30 am | Bike (hill repeats) | 45 min |
| Tue | 6:30 am | Strength Training (upper body) | 45 min |
| Wed | 6:30 am | Run (tempo) | 45 min |
| Thu | 6:30 am | Swim (sprints) | 45 min |
| Fri | 6:30 am | Rest or Active Recovery (e.g., yoga, walk) | 30 min |
| Sat | 7:00 am | Run (long, steady state) | 60 min |
| Sun | 7:00 am | Bike (long, steady state) | 60 min |

**Strength Training:**

* Lower body (Wed): Focus on exercises like squats, lunges, deadlifts, and calf raises.
* Upper body (Tue, Week 3-4): Focus on exercises like push-ups, pull-ups, dumbbell rows, and shoulder presses.

**Swim Workouts:**

* Endurance (Mon, Week 1-2): Swim at a moderate pace, aiming for 20-30 minutes of continuous swimming.
* Sprints (Thu, Week 3-4): Incorporate short sprints (25-50 yards) with active recovery in between.

**Bike Workouts:**

* Easy spin (Tue, Week 1-2): Ride at a leisurely pace, focusing on spinning your legs and getting comfortable on the bike.
* Hill repeats (Mon, Week 3-4): Find a route with rolling hills and ride up them at a high intensity, recovering on the downhill sections.
* Brisk ride (Sat, Week 1-2): Ride at a moderate to high intensity, aiming for a steady state pace.
* Long, steady state (Sun, Week 3-4): Ride at a comfortable pace, focusing on building endurance.

**Run Workouts:**

* Intervals (Thu, Week 1-2): Incorporate interval workouts, such as 4-6 x 800m at a fast pace, with active recovery in between.
* Tempo (Wed, Week 3-4): Run at a moderate to high intensity, aiming for a steady state pace.
* Long, steady state (Sun, Week 1-2 and Sat, Week 3-4): Run at a comfortable pace, focusing on building endurance.

Remember to:

* Warm up before each workout with 10-15 minutes of light cardio and dynamic stretching.
* Cool down with static stretching after each workout.
* Listen to your body and rest when needed
